CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, pg. 1 reads: "Levinson Award Winners - The Rev. Leroy A. Patrick, center, and Wister L. Lynch, right, were designated as the 1953 winners of the James and Rachel Levinson Foundation Brotherhood Awards. Jacob Levinson represented the foundation, which made the awards for the "outstanding individual contribution to the principles of brotherhood."  The awards were given for the work of the Rev. Mr. Patrick and Mr. Lynch in ending racial discrimination at the Highland Park Pool. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jacob Levinson presenting Rev. Leroy A. Patrick and Wister Lynch with the James and Rachel Levinson Foundation Brotherhood Awards, standing in interior
